Suits by or against the Government or Pu.4: Agent for Government to receive process.
Suits by or against the Government or Pu.5: Fixing of day for appearance on behalf of Government.
Suits by or against the Government or Pu.5A: Government to be joined as a party in a suit against a public officer.
Suits by or against the Government or Pu.5B: Duty of Court in suits against the Government or a public officer to assist in arriving at a settlement.
Suits by or against the Government or Pu.6: Attendance of person able to answer questions relating to suit against Government.
Suits by or against the Government or Pu.7: Extension of time to enable public officer to make reference to Government.
Suits by or against the Government or Pu.8: Procedure in suits against public officer.
Suits by or against the Government or Pu.8A: No security to be required from Government or a public officer in certain cases.

Suits Involving a Substantial Question o.1: Notice to the Attorney General or the Advocate-General.
Suits Involving a Substantial Question o.1A: Procedure in suits involving validity of any statutory instrument.
Suits Involving a Substantial Question o.2: Court may add Government as party.
Suits Involving a Substantial Question o.2A: Power of Court to add Government or other authority as a defendant in a suit relating to the validity of any statutory instrument.

Suits by or Against Military or Naval me.1: Officers, soldiers, sailors or airmen who cannot obtain leave may authorise any person to sue or defend for them.
Suits by or Against Military or Naval me.2: Person so authorised may act personally or appoint pleader.
Suits by or Against Military or Naval me.3: Service on person so authorised, or on his pleader, to be good service.

Suits by or against corporations.3: Production of documents on which corporation sues or relies.
Suits by or against corporations.5: Power of Court to require personal attendance of representative of corporation.
Suits by or against corporations.7: Suits by or against firms under disability.
Suits by or against corporations.8: Suits by or against trustees, executors or administrators.
Suits by or against corporations.10: Suits by or against persons of unsound mind.
Suits by or against corporations.11: Suits by next friend or guardian.
Suits by or against corporations.12: Where suit may proceed in name of dead person.
Suits by or against corporations.13: Duty of pleader to supply court with copies of authorities.
Suits by or against corporations.15: Payment into Court in suits by or against firm.
